ground_truth_reviews.comment: When catching `PostNotFoundException` and raising `HTTPException`, the original exception context is being lost. This makes debugging more difficult as the original stack trace is discarded. To preserve this valuable information, you should chain the exceptions using `raise from`. The fix would be to raise the new exception from the original one: `raise HTTPException(...) from e`.

title: feat: Add 404 handling for get_post endpoint
body: This change adds error handling to the `get_post` endpoint. When the service layer indicates a post is not found by raising `PostNotFoundException`, the API will now catch it and return a user-friendly 404 Not Found response instead of a generic 500 error.
